page.title: 17MYTTON & FITZ-ECOLOGY
page.content: {ECOLOGY { }Such a rural area has many aspects of wildlife in the abundant hedgerow.Many wild flowers add bright colour to the roadsides,and we found specimins of tufted vetch,cowslip,meadow buttercup,sopwort & many others.Unlike other parts of England,this areas has many trees and is wooded on all sides. The oak,cycamore and beech are very common and most of them are of a very large size. Apart from plants,there are other aspects of wildlife:the River Severn houses many varieties of fish,eg.trout.Water birds such herons are also to be found.The entire area is rich with wildlife.
